subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: A family member of James J. Jeffries said he supported a posthumous presidential pardon for the man who whipped Jeffries in the so-called Fight of the Century in Reno, Nev., a century ago.
snippet: A family member of James J. Jeffries said he supported a posthumous presidential pardon for the man who whipped Jeffries in the so-called Fight of the Century in Reno, Nev., a century ago.
